title: Authors and Citation
text: El Hattab H, Allaire J, Gilligan J (2025). revealjg: R Markdown Format 'reveal.js' Presentations. R package version 1.0.0, https://github.com/jonathan-g/revealjg.
code: @Manual{,   title = {revealjg: R Markdown Format for 'reveal.js' Presentations},   author = {Hakim {El Hattab} and JJ Allaire and Jonathan Gilligan},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 1.0.0},   url = {https://github.com/jonathan-g/revealjg}, }

title: RMarkdown format for `reveal.js` presentations
text: Overview Rendering Display Modes Incremental Bullets Appearance Style Slide Transitions Slide Backgrounds 2-D Presentations Reveal Options Figure Options MathJax Equations Document Dependencies Reveal Version Reveal Plugins Advanced Customization Shared Options

title: RMarkdown format for `reveal.js` presentations
text: repository provides R Markdown custom format reveal.js HTML presentations. can use format R Markdown documents installing package follows: create reveal.js presentation R Markdown specify revealjs_presentation output format front-matter document. can create slide show broken sections using # ## heading tags (can also create new slide without header using horizontal rule (----). example ’s simple slide show:
code: remotes::installgithub("jonathan-g/revealjg") --- title: "Habits" author: John Doe date: March 22, 2005 output: revealjg::revealjs_presentation ---  # In the morning  ## Getting up  - Turn off alarm - Get out of bed  ## Breakfast  - Eat eggs - Drink coffee  # In the evening  ## Dinner  - Eat spaghetti - Drink wine  ## Going to sleep  - Get in bed - Count sheep

title: RMarkdown format for `reveal.js` presentations
text: Depending use case, 3 ways can render presentation. RStudio R console Terminal (e.g., bash)

title: RMarkdown format for `reveal.js` presentations
text: creating presentation RStudio, Knit button right source tabs. default, render current document place rendered HTML file directory source file, name. Note: Unlike slideshow outputs, slideshow viewer popup RStudio blank, view slide show click open browser button, slide show render default web browser.

title: RMarkdown format for `reveal.js` presentations
text: Knit button actually calling rmarkdown::render() function. , render document within R console: many output tweaks can use directly calling render. can read documentation details.
code: rmarkdown::render('my_reveal_presentation.Rmd')

title: RMarkdown format for `reveal.js` presentations
text: need presentation rendered command line:
code: Rscript -e "rmarkdown::render('my_reveal_presentation.Rmd')"

title: RMarkdown format for `reveal.js` presentations
text: following single character keyboard shortcuts enable alternate display modes: 'f' enable fullscreen mode 'o' enable overview mode Pressing Esc exits modes.

title: RMarkdown format for `reveal.js` presentations
text: can render bullets incrementally adding incremental option: want render bullets incrementally slides others can use syntax:
code: --- output:   revealjg::revealjs_presentation:     incremental: true --- > - Eat eggs > - Drink coffee

title: RMarkdown format for `reveal.js` presentations
text: several options control appearance revealjs presentations: theme specifies theme use presentation (available themes “default”, “simple”, “sky”, “beige”, “serif”, “solarized”, “blood”, “moon”, “night”, “black”, “league” “white”). highlight specifies syntax highlighting style. Supported styles include “default”, “tango”, “pygments”, “kate”, “monochrome”, “espresso”, “zenburn”, “haddock”. Pass null prevent syntax highlighting. center specifies whether want vertically center content slides (defaults false). smart indicates whether produce typographically correct output, converting straight quotes curly quotes, --- em-dashes, -- en-dashes, ... ellipses. Note smart enabled default. example:
code: --- output:   revealjg::revealjs_presentation:     theme: sky     highlight: pygments     center: true ---

title: RMarkdown format for `reveal.js` presentations
text: can use transition background_transition options specify global default slide transition style: transition specifies visual effect moving slides. Available transitions “default”, “fade”, “slide”, “convex”, “concave”, “zoom” “none”. background_transition specifies background transition effect moving full page slides. Available transitions “default”, “fade”, “slide”, “convex”, “concave”, “zoom” “none”. example: can override global transition specific slide using data-transition attribute, example: can also use different transitions slide, example:
code: --- output:   revealjg::revealjs_presentation:     transition: fade --- ## Use a zoom transition {data-transition="zoom"}  ## Use a faster speed {data-transition-speed="fast"} ## Fade in, Slide out {data-transition="slide-in fade-out"}  ## Slide in, Fade out {data-transition="fade-in slide-out"}

title: RMarkdown format for `reveal.js` presentations
text: Slides contained within limited portion screen default allow fit display scale uniformly. can apply full page backgrounds outside slide area adding data-background attribute slide header element. Four different types backgrounds supported: color, image, video iframe. examples. Backgrounds transition using fade animation default. can changed linear sliding transition specifying background-transition: slide. Alternatively can set data-background-transition slide background override specific transition.
code: ## CSS color background {data-background=#ff0000}  ## Full size image background {data-background="background.jpeg"}  ## Video background {data-background-video="background.mp4"}  ## Embed a web page as a background {data-background-iframe="https://example.com"}

title: RMarkdown format for `reveal.js` presentations
text: can use slide_level option specify level heading used denote individual slides. slide_level 2 (default), two-dimensional layout produced, level 1 headers building horizontally level 2 headers building vertically. example: layout horizontal navigation proceed directly “Horizontal Slide 1” “Horizontal Slide 2”, vertical navigation “Vertical Slide 1”, etc. presented option “Horizontal Slide 1”.
code: # Horizontal Slide 1  ## Vertical Slide 1  ## Vertical Slide 2  # Horizontal Slide 2

title: RMarkdown format for `reveal.js` presentations
text: Reveal.js many additional options configure ’s behavior. can specify options using reveal_options, example: can find documentation various available Reveal.js options : https://github.com/hakimel/reveal.js#configuration.
code: --- title: "Habits" output:   revealjg::revealjs_presentation:     self_contained: false     reveal_options:       slideNumber: true       previewLinks: true ---

title: RMarkdown format for `reveal.js` presentations
text: number options affect output figures within reveal.js presentations: fig_width fig_height can used control default figure width height (7x5 used default) fig_retina Specifies scaling perform retina displays (defaults 2, currently works widely used retina displays). Note takes effect using knitr >= 1.5.21. Set null prevent retina scaling. fig_caption controls whether figures rendered captions example:
code: --- title: "Habits" output:   revealjg::revealjs_presentation:     fig_width: 7     fig_height: 6     fig_caption: true ---

title: RMarkdown format for `reveal.js` presentations
text: default MathJax scripts included reveal.js presentations rendering LaTeX MathML equations. can use mathjax option control MathJax included: Specify “default” use https URL official MathJax CDN. Specify “local” use local version MathJax (copied output directory). Note using “local” also need set self_contained option false. Specify alternate URL load MathJax another location. Specify null exclude MathJax entirely. example, use local copy MathJax: use self-hosted copy MathJax: exclude MathJax entirely:
code: --- title: "Habits" output:   revealjg::revealjs_presentation:     mathjax: local     self_contained: false --- --- title: "Habits" output:   revealjg::revealjs_presentation:     mathjax: "http://example.com/mathjax/MathJax.js?config=TeX-AMS-MML_HTMLorMML" --- --- title: "Habits" output:   revealjg::revealjs_presentation:     mathjax: null ---

title: RMarkdown format for `reveal.js` presentations
text: default R Markdown produces standalone HTML files external dependencies, using data: URIs incorporate contents linked scripts, stylesheets, images, videos. means can share publish file just like share Office documents PDFs. ’d rather keep dependencies external files can specify self_contained: false. example: Note even self contained documents MathJax still loaded externally (necessary ’s size). want serve MathJax locally specify mathjax: local self_contained: false. One common reason keep dependencies external serving R Markdown documents website (external dependencies can cached separately browsers leading faster page load times). case serving multiple R Markdown documents may also want consolidate dependent library files (e.g. Bootstrap, MathJax, etc.) single directory shared multiple documents. can use lib_dir option , example:
code: --- title: "Habits" output:   revealjg::revealjs_presentation:     self_contained: false --- --- title: "Habits" output:   revealjg::revealjs_presentation:     self_contained: false     lib_dir: libs ---

title: RMarkdown format for `reveal.js` presentations
text: Reveal.js underwent serious refactoring major versions 4 5, revealjg includes option specifying reveal.js version use. affects html template pandoc uses render slides affects directory structure finding .css .js files reveal.js directory. default, revealjg uses reveal.js version 5.2.1.
code: --- title: "Habits" output:   revealjg::revealjs_presentation:     reveal_version: "5.2.1"     self_contained: false     lib_dir: libs ---

title: RMarkdown format for `reveal.js` presentations
text: can enable various reveal.js plugins using reveal_plugins option. Plugins currently supported include: Note use plugins requires self_contained option set false. example, presentation includes “notes” “search” plugins: can specify additional options chalkboard menu plugins using reveal_options, example:
code: --- title: "Habits" output:   revealjs::revealjs_presentation:     self_contained: false     reveal_plugins: ["notes", "search"] --- --- title: "Habits" output:   revealjs::revealjs_presentation:     self_contained: false     reveal_plugins: ["chalkboard", "menu"]     reveal_options:       chalkboard:         theme: whiteboard         toggleNotesButton: false       menu:         side: right ---

title: RMarkdown format for `reveal.js` presentations
text: can advanced customization output including additional HTML content replacing core pandoc template entirely. include content document header /document body use includes option follows:
code: --- title: "Habits" output:   revealjg::revealjs_presentation:     includes:       in_header: header.html       before_body: doc_prefix.html       after_body: doc_suffix.html ---

title: RMarkdown format for `reveal.js` presentations
text: pandoc features want use lack equivalents YAML options described can still use passing custom pandoc_args. example: Documentation available pandoc arguments can found pandoc user guide.
code: --- title: "Habits" output:   revealjg::revealjs_presentation:     pandoc_args: [       "--title-prefix", "Foo",       "--id-prefix", "Bar"     ] ---

title: RMarkdown format for `reveal.js` presentations
text: want specify set default options shared multiple documents within directory can include file named _output.yaml within directory. Note YAML delimiters enclosing output object used file. example: _output.yaml documents located directory _output.yaml inherit ’s options. Options defined explicitly within documents override specified shared options file.
code: revealjg::revealjs_presentation:   theme: sky   transition: fade   highlight: pygments

what: Postprocess a reveal.js HTML file — revealjg_postprocessor
title: Postprocess a reveal.js HTML file — revealjg_postprocessor
text: Postprocesses reveal.js HTML file modify list items user-supplied classes.

title: Postprocess a reveal.js HTML file — revealjg_postprocessor
code: revealjg_postprocessor(metadata, input_file, output_file, clean, verbose)

title: Postprocess a reveal.js HTML file — revealjg_postprocessor
text: metadata YAML metadata passed rmarkdown::render input_file RMarkdown source file output_file HTML file produced Pandoc clean logical value indicating whether delete intermediate files rendering. verbose Issue verbose progress reports rendering.

title: Postprocess a reveal.js HTML file — revealjg_postprocessor
text: character string name output file.   Options fragment style include: Colors:  red, green, blue, med-blue, dark-green Current colors:  cred, cgreen, cblue, cmed-blue, cdark-green : grow, shrink, strike, semi-fade-, fade-, fade-, fade-, fade-left, fade-right, fade---, fade---semi-
code: * {+4} This has index 4, so it appears out of order * {+1:blue} This fragment uses the `highlight-blue` class. * {+3:cred} This fragment has index 3 and uses the `highlight-current-red`   class * {+2:grow} This fragment grows when it's activated * {.fragment .grow data-fragment-index="1"} This fragment grows at the same   time the first one appears.

title: Postprocess a reveal.js HTML file — revealjg_postprocessor
text: function predominantly intended giving finer-scale control fragments lists. RMarkdown perspective, list item can modified adding metadata curly braces immediately *. contents braces parsed classes fragment indices. Examples include:   can also play fragment indices control order fragments appear, need set indices every fragment list. can also add classes control fragments activated.
code: * {.fragment} This is a simple fragment. * {+} This is another simple fragment.

what: Convert to a reveal.js presentation — revealjs_presentation
title: Convert to a reveal.js presentation — revealjs_presentation
text: Format converting R Markdown reveal.js presentation.

title: Convert to a reveal.js presentation — revealjs_presentation
code: revealjs_presentation(   incremental = FALSE,   center = FALSE,   width = NULL,   height = NULL,   margin = NULL,   slide_level = 2,   fig_width = 8,   fig_height = 6,   fig_retina = if (!fig_caption) 2,   fig_caption = FALSE,   self_contained = TRUE,   smart = TRUE,   theme = "simple",   custom_theme = NULL,   custom_theme_dark = FALSE,   custom_asset_path = NULL,   transition = "default",   custom_transition = NULL,   background_transition = "default",   custom_background_transition = NULL,   reveal_options = NULL,   reveal_plugins = NULL,   reveal_version = "5.2.1",   reveal_location = "default",   resource_location = "default",   controls = FALSE,   highlight = "default",   mathjax = "default",   mathjax_scale = NULL,   tex_extensions = NULL,   tex_defs = NULL,   template = "default",   css = NULL,   includes = NULL,   md_extensions = NULL,   keep_md = FALSE,   lib_dir = NULL,   pandoc_args = NULL,   extra_dependencies = NULL,   custom_plugins = NULL,   no_postprocess = FALSE,   ... )

title: Convert to a reveal.js presentation — revealjs_presentation
text: incremental TRUE render slide bullets incrementally. Note want reverse default incremental behavior individual bullet can precede >. example: > - Bullet Text. See Pandoc's Manual center TRUE vertically center content slides width NULL override default width (pixels) height NULL override default height (pixels) margin NULL override default margin around slides. slide_level Level heading denote individual slides. slide_level 2 (default), two-dimensional layout produced, level 1 headers building horizontally level 2 headers building vertically. recommended use deeper nesting section levels reveal.js. fig_width Default width (inches) figures fig_height Default height (inches) figures fig_retina Scaling perform retina displays (defaults 2, currently works widely used retina displays). Set NULL prevent retina scaling. Note always NULL keep_md specified (fig_retina relies outputting HTML directly markdown document). fig_caption TRUE render figures captions self_contained Whether generate full LaTeX document (TRUE) just body LaTeX document (FALSE). Note LaTeX document intermediate file unless keep_tex = TRUE. smart Use smartypants transformations special characters punctuation. theme Visual theme ("simple", "sky", "beige", "moon", "night", "solarized", "league", "serif", "blood", "dracula", "black", "black-contrast", "white", "white-contrast"). custom_theme Custom theme, included reveal.js distribution custom_theme_dark custom theme use dark-mode? custom_asset_path Path custom theme css. transition Slide transition ("default", "none", "fade", "slide", "convex", "concave" "zoom") custom_transition Custom slide transition, included reveal.js distribuion. background_transition Slide background-transition ("default", "none", "fade", "slide", "convex", "concave" "zoom") custom_background_transition Custom background-transition, included reveal.js distribuion. reveal_options Additional options specify reveal.js (see https://github.com/hakimel/reveal.js#configuration details). reveal_plugins Reveal plugins include. Available plugins include "notes", "search", "zoom", "chalkboard", "menu". Note self_contained must set FALSE order use Reveal plugins. reveal_version Version reveal.js use. reveal_location Location search reveal.js (Expects find reveal.js distribution file.path(reveal_location, paste0('revealjs-', reveal_version)) resource_location Optional custom path reveal.js templates skeletons controls TRUE show navigation controls slides highlight Syntax highlighting style passed Pandoc. Supported built-styles include "default", "tango", "pygments", "kate",  "monochrome", "espresso", "zenburn", "haddock", "breezedark". Two custom styles also included, "arrow", accessible color scheme,   "rstudio", mimics default IDE theme. Alternatively, supply   path .theme file use   custom Pandoc   style. Note custom theme requires Pandoc 2.0+. Pass NULL prevent syntax highlighting. mathjax Include mathjax. "default" option uses https URL MathJax CDN. "local" option uses local version MathJax (copied output directory). can pass alternate URL pass NULL exclude MathJax entirely. mathjax_scale Scale (percent) MathJax. Default = 100 tex_extensions LaTeX extensions MathJax tex_defs LaTeX macro definitions MathJax template Pandoc template use rendering. Pass "default" use rmarkdown package default template; pass NULL use pandoc's built-template; pass path use custom template created. Note use "default" template features revealjs_presentation available (see Templates section details). css CSS /Sass files include. Files extension .sass .scss compiled CSS via sass::sass(). Also, theme bslib::bs_theme() object, Sass code may reference relevant Bootstrap Sass variables, functions, mixins, etc. includes Named list additional content include within document (typically created using includes function). md_extensions Pandoc markdown extensions keep_md Keep markdown file generated knitting. lib_dir Directory copy dependent HTML libraries (e.g. jquery, bootstrap, etc.) . default name document _files appended . pandoc_args Additional command line options pass pandoc extra_dependencies Additional function arguments pass base R Markdown HTML output formatter rmarkdown::html_document_base(). custom_plugins Add custom plugins list supported plugins. no_postprocess Omit post-processing step. ... Ignored

title: Convert to a reveal.js presentation — revealjs_presentation
text: R Markdown output format pass render

title: Convert to a reveal.js presentation — revealjs_presentation
text: reveal.js presentations can use level 1 level 2 headers slides. use mix level 1 level 2 headers two-dimensional layout produced, level 1 headers building horizontally level 2 headers building vertically. additional documentation using revealjs presentations see https://github.com/jonathan-g/revealjg.

title: Convert to a reveal.js presentation — revealjs_presentation
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{  library(rmarkdown) library(revealjg)  # simple invocation render("pres.Rmd", revealjs_presentation())  # specify an option for incremental rendering render("pres.Rmd", revealjs_presentation(incremental = TRUE)) } # }
